alert_warn_detail: Ideal >= 10. This usually indicates poor cell quality, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_error_detail: No valid sequencing data was detected. Please check the sequencing data.
help_description: The number of barcodes estimated to be associated with cells that express targeted V(D)J transcripts.
Number of input read pairs divided by the estimated number of cells.

full_name: Number of Cells With Productive V-J Spanning Pair
help_description: Number of cell barcodes for which at least 1 full-length productive sequence was found for each gene in a receptor pair.

full_name: Reads Mapped to Any V(D)J Gene
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction of Reads Mapped to Any V(D)J Gene.
alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 50%. This can indicate poor specificity of the V(D)J enrichment, use of the wrong germline reference, or the use of an unsupported chemistry type (e.g., using Single Cell 3' for V(D)J assembly). Application performance may be affected.
alert_error_detail: Ideal > 50%. This can indicate poor specificity of the V(D)J enrichment, use of the wrong germline reference, or the use of an unsupported chemistry type (e.g., using Single Cell 3' for V(D)J assembly). Application performance is likely to be affected.
help_description: Fraction of reads with valid barcodes that partially or wholly map to any germline V(D)J gene segment.
Fraction of reads with valid barcodes that map partially or wholly to a germline {chain} gene segment.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 0. This can indicate cells with extremely low {chain} expression, poor cell quality, low yield from the RT reaction, or the use of an unsupported chemistry type (e.g., using Single Cell 3' for V(D)J assembly). Application performance may be affected.
help_description: Median number of UMIs assigned to a {chain} contig per cell. For B cells, only the max of [IGK, IGL] are counted.

full_name: Cells With Productive V-J Spanning Pair
alert_warn_name: Low Cells With Productive V-J Spanning Pair
alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 30%. This can indicate poor cell quality, low yield from the RT reaction, poor specificity of the V(D)J enrichment, poor sequencing quality, or the use of an unsupported chemistry type (e.g., using Single Cell 3' for V(D)J assembly). Application performance may be affected
alert_error_detail: Ideal > 30%. This can indicate poor cell quality, low yield from the RT reaction, poor specificity of the V(D)J enrichment, poor sequencing quality, or the use of an unsupported chemistry type (e.g., using Single Cell 3' for V(D)J assembly). Application performance is likely to be affected
help_description: Fraction of cell-associated barcodes with at least one productive contig for each chain of the receptor pair. A productive contig satisfies the following conditions: the contig annotations span the 5' end of the V region to the 3' end of the J region of the chain, a start codon was found in the expected part of the V sequence, an in-frame CDR3 amino acid motif was found, and no stop codons were found in the aligned V-J region.

full_name: Cells With Productive V-J Spanning (TRA, TRB) Pair
help_description: Fraction of cell-associated barcodes with at least one productive contig for each chain of the (TRA, TRB) receptor pair. A productive contig satisfies the following conditions: the contig annotations span the 5' end of the V region to the 3' end of the J region of the chain, a start codon was found in the expected part of the V sequence, an in-frame CDR3 amino acid motif was found, and no stop codons were found in the aligned V-J region.

full_name: Cells With Productive V-J Spanning (IGK, IGH) Pair
help_description: Fraction of cell-associated barcodes with at least one productive contig for each chain of the (IGK, IGH) receptor pair. A productive contig satisfies the following conditions: the contig annotations span the 5' end of the V region to the 3' end of the J region of the chain, a start codon was found in the expected part of the V sequence, an in-frame CDR3 amino acid motif was found, and no stop codons were found in the aligned V-J region.

full_name: Cells With Productive V-J Spanning (IGL, IGH) Pair
help_description: Fraction of cell-associated barcodes with at least one productive contig for each chain of the (IGL, IGH) receptor pair. A productive contig satisfies the following conditions: the contig annotations span the 5' end of the V region to the 3' end of the J region of the chain, a start codon was found in the expected part of the V sequence, an in-frame CDR3 amino acid motif was found, and no stop codons were found in the aligned V-J region.

Effective diversity of the paired clonotypes, computed as the Inverse Simpson Index of the clonotype frequencies. A value of 1 indicates a minimally diverse sample - only one distinct clonotype was detected. A value equal to the estimated number of cells indicates a maximally diverse sample.
Fraction of cell-associated barcodes with at least one {chain} contig annotated as a full or partial V(D)J gene.
Fraction of cell-associated barcodes with at least one {chain} contig where a CDR3 was detected.
Fraction of cell-associated barcodes with at least one contig spanning the 5' end of the V region to  the 3' end of the J region for {chain}.

Fraction of cell-associated barcodes with at least one contig that spans the 5' end of the V region to the 3' end of the J region for {chain}, has a start codon in the expected part of the V sequence, has an in-frame CDR3, and has no stop codons in the aligned V-J region.
Total number of read pairs that were assigned to this library in demultiplexing.
Total number of read pairs that were ignored by the pipeline because they do not satisfy the minimum length requirements (for example read1 less that 26 bases).

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 85%. This usually indicates a quality issue with the Ilumina R1 read. Application performance may be affected.
alert_error_detail: Ideal > 85%. This usually indicates a quality issue with the Ilumina R1 read. Application performance is likely to be affected.
help_description: Fraction of reads with barcodes that match the whitelist after barcode correction.

alert_warn_name: Low Barcode Q30 Fraction (Illumina R1 for Single Cell V(D)J)
alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 90%. Application performance may be affected.
alert_error_detail: Ideal > 90%. Application performance is likely to be affected.
help_description: Fraction of cell barcode bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.

alert_warn_name: Low RNA Read Q30 Fraction (Illumina R1 for Single Cell V(D)J)
alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 85%. Application performance may be affected.
alert_error_detail: Ideal > 85%. Application performance is likely to be affected.
help_description: Fraction of RNA read 1 bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.

alert_warn_name: Low RNA Read 2 Q30 Fraction (Illumina R2 for Single Cell V(D)J)
alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 75%. Application performance may be affected.
alert_error_detail: Ideal > 75%. Application performance is likely to be affected.
help_description: Fraction of RNA read 2 bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.

alert_warn_name: Low UMI Q30 Fraction (Illumina R1 for Single Cell V(D)J)
alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 90%. Application performance may be affected.
alert_error_detail: Ideal > 90%. Application performance is likely to be affected.
help_description: Fraction of UMI bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Mean number of read pairs used in assembly per cell-associated barcode. These reads must have a cell-associated barcode, map to a V(D)J gene, and have a UMI with sufficient read support.
Number of reads with cell-associated barcodes divided by the number of reads with valid barcodes.
Number of productive UMIs in non-cell barcodes divided by the total number of productive UMIs.
Number of productive contigs in non-cell barcodes divided by the total number of productive contigs.
